message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG

Reasoning: The paper deals with the algebraic structure of linear codes and their decoding process, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The use of binomial ideals and Gröbner bases suggests a connection to computational algebraic geometry (cs.CG) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The mention of test-sets and Hamming metric decoding also suggests a connection to coding theory (cs.DS) and complexity theory (cs.CC).
